Row.Text: Requires Order. 1 Free Social Policy. +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from Workshops, Windmills, and Factories.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Requires Order. 1 Free Social Policy. +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from Workshops, Windmills, and Factories.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Source: Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Motherland_Calls)[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Motherland Calls is the compositional center of the monument-ensemble "Heroes of the Battle of Stalingrad" on Mamayev Kurgan in Volgograd, Russia. It was designed by sculptor Yevgeny Vuchetich and structural engineer Nikolai Nikitin, and declared the tallest statue in the world in 1967. The statue is an 85 metre figure of a woman stepping forward with a raised sword. It is the tallest statue in Europe, the tallest statue (excluding any pedestal) of a woman in the world and the tallest freestanding non-religious statue in the world.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Credits: The Motherland Calls Wonder - Pouakai, Sukritact[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Source: Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Motherland_Calls)[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Motherland Calls is the compositional center of the monument-ensemble "Heroes of the Battle of Stalingrad" on Mamayev Kurgan in Volgograd, Russia. It was designed by sculptor Yevgeny Vuchetich and structural engineer Nikolai Nikitin, and declared the tallest statue in the world in 1967. The statue is an 85 metre figure of a woman stepping forward with a raised sword. It is the tallest statue in Europe, the tallest statue (excluding any pedestal) of a woman in the world and the tallest freestanding non-religious statue in the world.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Credits: The Motherland Calls Wonder - Pouakai, Sukritact[ENDCOLOR]

It was designed by sculptor Yevgeny Vuchetich and structural engineer Nikolai Nikitin, and declared the tallest statue in the world in 1967. The statue is an 85 metre figure of a woman stepping forward with a raised sword. It is the tallest statue in Europe, the tallest statue (excluding any pedestal) of a woman in the world and the tallest freestanding non-religious statue in the world.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Credits: The Motherland Calls Wonder - Pouakai, Sukritact[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Source: Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Motherland_Calls)[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Motherland Calls is the compositional center of the monument-ensemble "Heroes of the Battle of Stalingrad" on Mamayev Kurgan in Volgograd, Russia. It was designed by sculptor Yevgeny Vuchetich and structural engineer Nikolai Nikitin, and declared the tallest statue in the world in 1967. The statue is an 85 metre figure of a woman stepping forward with a raised sword. It is the tallest statue in Europe, the tallest statue (excluding any pedestal) of a woman in the world and the tallest freestanding non-religious statue in the world.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Credits: The Motherland Calls Wonder - Pouakai, Sukritact[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"One of the hallmarks of a great nation is its ability to rise through its feet after a fall."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Theodore Roosevelt[NEWLINE][TAB]
